result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Liss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Coin Box, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.125(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:02 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF123, 15CM258, 15CM176, 14CM2052, AND 15CF506. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays. 
COURT notes PSI. 
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections from either party. 
State notes deft has paid restitution today. 
VRCW. 
State notes joint recommendation of the parties. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF123: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ. 
                    : Ct. 5>>30 days MCJ.
In 15CM258: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ. 
In 15CM176: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ. 
In 14CM2052: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ.
In 15CF506: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ; DNA sample and surcharge. 

COURT ORDERS jail sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and with huber for work/school/treatment if def qualifies. 
COURT gives deft 45 days to start jail sentence. 

COURT finds deft entitled to credit as follows: 
In 15CF123>>3 days jail credit. 
In 15CM258>>3 days jail credit. 
In 15CM176>>NO days jail credit. 
In 14CM2052>>NO days jail credit. 
In 15CF506>>1 day jail credit. 

COURT does NOT order DNA samples/surcharges in 15CF123, 15CM258. 15CM176, and 14CM2052. 
COURT allows parties retain their copies of PSI and advises them to maintain their confidentiality.

Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

INCLUDES 15CF123, 15CM258.  $5,000.00 signature bond with first $500.00 in cash.  Absolute sobriety - drugs.  No contact with victim(s):  Office Bar (in file 15CM258).   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
